page.title: 03Broadhembry Continued.......
page.content: Woodlands are managed economically and contain rhododendrons as well as conifers. Some old beech trees and the odd chesnut still survive, and, with the scrub land above the bogs, provides habitat for deer as well as pheasants and rabbits. A caravan site mainly for tourin vans, is descreetly situated at the back end of North Hill, between an avenue of beech trees and woodlands. (Due to the steepness of the hill and the acuteness of the bends on its, the site is really only accessible from the east).
